protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
description:
Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010).

 

Quickly and easily purify up to 100 µg of high-quality total RNA from multiple sample types – all with one kit!

  • For use with blood, cells and tissues
  • Also works with tough to lyse samples (bacteria, yeast, plant)
  • Effectively purifies total RNA of all sizes, including small RNAs >20 nt
  • Efficient genomic DNA removal (column and DNase I-based)
  • Contains Proteinase K for processing of tissues and blood samples
  • Includes RNA Protection Reagent for sample preservation
  • Excellent value
  • Kit components available separately
before_start:
• Addition of RNA Lysis Buffer and all subsequent steps should be performed at room temperature to prevent formation of precipitate. If samples are accidentally placed on ice and precipitate forms, allow the samples to return to room temperature to resolubilize before loading onto the column.
  • Protocols are also available for RNA reaction cleanup, RNA fractionation, and extraction of RNA from other sample types (including those in preservation reagents or TRIzol®).

 

For the 50 prep kit:

  • Reconstitute DNase I by adding 275 µl­­ nuclease-free water. Gently invert to mix. Aliquot for storage at -20°C to minimize freeze-thaw cycles.
  • Reconstitute Proteinase K (Prot K) by adding 1040 µl of Proteinase K Resuspension Buffer. Vortex and store at -20°C.
  • Add 100 ml ethanol (≥ 95%) to the 25 ml RNA Wash Buffer concentrate.
warning: Please refer to the SDS for safety warnings.
guidelines:
We recommend that first-time users of this kit review the product manual before starting. The manual provides additional relevant information to consider at various steps. This quick protocol is meant for experienced users.

 

RNA Purification Consists of Two Stages:

PART 1: Sample Disruption and Homogenization (Differs depending on starting material)
PART 2: RNA Binding and Elution

 

Have any questions?

Our tech support scientists would be happy to help. Email us at info@neb.com.

components.data:
Please select your starting material of the following:

- Cultured Mammalian Cells

- Mammalian Whole Blood (Fresh or Frozen)

- Tissue or Leukocytes

- Tough-to-Lyse Samples (bacteria, yeast, plant, etc.) using Mechanical Lysis
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Please select your starting material of the following:

- Cultured Mammalian Cells

- Mammalian Whole Blood (Fresh or Frozen)

- Tissue or Leukocytes

- Tough-to-Lyse Samples (bacteria, yeast, plant, etc.) using Mechanical Lysis

components.data: Pellet cells by centrifugation (500 x g) for 1 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pellet cells by centrifugation (500 x g) for 1 min.
Discard supernatant.

components.data:
Resuspend pellet in RNA Lysis Buffer (according to table below) by pipetting gently to avoid foaming. 

 

AMOUNT OF CELLS VOLUME OF RNA LYSIS BUFFER
up to 3 x 106 300 µl
3 x 106 to 1 x 107  ≥ 600 µl
components.name: Description

3 x 106 to 1 x 107  ≥ 600 µl

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.annotation: Do not place samples on ice. For frozen pellets, thaw briefly before resuspension.
source_data.thread_text: Do not place samples on ice. For frozen pellets, thaw briefly before resuspension.
source_data.body: Do not place samples on ice. For frozen pellets, thaw briefly before resuspension.

components.data:
Transfer up to 800 µl of the sample from PART 1 to a gDNA removal column  (light blue) fitted with a collection tube.

For sample identification, label collection tubes, as gDNA removal columns will be discarded after spinning.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Transfer up to 800 µl of the sample from PART 1 to a gDNA removal column  (light blue) fitted with a collection tube.

For sample identification, label collection tubes, as gDNA removal columns will be discarded after spinning.

source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.annotation: All centrifugation steps should be performed at 16,000 x g.
source_data.thread_text: All centrifugation steps should be performed at 16,000 x g.
source_data.body: All centrifugation steps should be performed at 16,000 x g.

components.data: Spin for 30 seconds to remove most of the gDNA. SAVE THE FLOW-THROUGH (RNA partitions here). Discard the gDNA removal column.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin for 30 seconds to remove most of the gDNA. SAVE THE FLOW-THROUGH (RNA partitions here). Discard the gDNA removal column.

components.data: Add an equal volume of ethanol (≥ 95%) to the flow-through and mix thoroughly by pipetting. Do not vortex. To exclude RNA ≷ 200 nt, add only 1/2 volume ethanol to flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of ethanol (≥ 95%) to the flow-through and mix thoroughly by pipetting. Do not vortex. To exclude RNA ≷ 200 nt, add only 1/2 volume ethanol to flow-through.

components.data: Transfer mixture to an RNA purification column  (dark blue) fitted with a collection tube. Spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through. If further gDNA removal is essential for downstream applications, proceed to on-column DNase I treatment, steps 9-11 (recommended). If not, proceed to Step 12.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer mixture to an RNA purification column  (dark blue) fitted with a collection tube. Spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through. If further gDNA removal is essential for downstream applications, proceed to on-column DNase I treatment, steps 9-11 (recommended). If not, proceed to Step 12.

components.data:
[Optional (but recommended)] On-column DNase I treatment for enzymatic removal of residual gDNA:

Add 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
[Optional (but recommended)] On-column DNase I treatment for enzymatic removal of residual gDNA:

Add 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.

components.data: [Optional (but recommended)] In an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included), combine 5 µl DNase I with 75 µl DNase I Reaction Buffer and pipet directly to the top of the column matrix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [Optional (but recommended)] In an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included), combine 5 µl DNase I with 75 µl DNase I Reaction Buffer and pipet directly to the top of the column matrix.

components.data: [Optional (but recommended)] Incubate for 15 minutes at room temperature.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: [Optional (but recommended)] Incubate for 15 minutes at room temperature.

components.data: Add 500 µl RNA Priming Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl RNA Priming Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.

components.data: Add 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 30 seconds. Discard flow-through.

components.data: Add another 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 2 MINUTES.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add another 500 µl RNA Wash Buffer and spin for 2 MINUTES.

components.data: Transfer column to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included). Use care to ensure the tip of the column does not contact the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute to ensure no ethanol is carried over.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer column to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included). Use care to ensure the tip of the column does not contact the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for 1 minute to ensure no ethanol is carried over.

components.data: Add 30-100 µl Nuclease-free Water directly to the center of column matrix and spin for 30 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30-100 µl Nuclease-free Water directly to the center of column matrix and spin for 30 seconds.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 16 of Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.annotation: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A 260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.
source_data.thread_text: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A 260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.
source_data.body: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A 260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.

components.data: Place RNA on ice if being used for downstream steps, at -20°C for short-term storage (less than 1 week), or at -80°C for long-term storage. Addition of EDTA to 0.1-1.0 mM may reduce the activity of any contaminating RNases.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place RNA on ice if being used for downstream steps, at -20°C for short-term storage (less than 1 week), or at -80°C for long-term storage. Addition of EDTA to 0.1-1.0 mM may reduce the activity of any contaminating RNases.

components.data: Add an equal volume (up to 200 µl) of DNA/RNA Protection Reagent (2X concentrate) to an aliquot of whole blood and vortex briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume (up to 200 µl) of DNA/RNA Protection Reagent (2X concentrate) to an aliquot of whole blood and vortex briefly.

components.data: For every 400 µl of DNA/RNA Protection Reagent/blood mixture, add 10 µl of Prot K. Vortex briefly and incubate at room temperature for 30 min.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: For every 400 µl of DNA/RNA Protection Reagent/blood mixture, add 10 µl of Prot K. Vortex briefly and incubate at room temperature for 30 min.

components.data: Add an equal volume of isopropanol (not included) and vortex briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of isopropanol (not included) and vortex briefly.

components.data:
Determine the amount of 1X DNA/RNA Protection Reagent that you will need according to the table below. Prepare the 1X aliquot by diluting the 2X stock with nuclease-free water (not included for this step).

 

Sample Input Amount Volume 1X DNA/RNA Protection Reagent
Tissue (up to 10 mg) 300 µl
Tissue (10–30 mg) 300–600 µl
Tissue (30–50 mg) ≥ 600 µl
Leukocytes (up to 3 x 106) 300 µl
Leukocytes (3 x 106 to 1 x 107) ≥ 600 µl
components.name: Description

Leukocytes (3 x 106 to 1 x 107) ≥ 600 µl

components.data: Add 30-100 µl Nuclease-free Water directly to the center of column matrix and spin for 30 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30-100 µl Nuclease-free Water directly to the center of column matrix and spin for 30 seconds.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 19 of Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.annotation: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.
source_data.thread_text: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.
source_data.body: For best results, elute with at least 50 µl, which is the minimum volume needed to wet the membrane.  Lower volumes can be used but will result in lower recovery (elution in 30 µl results in > 80% recovery and 100 µl provides maximum recovery).  For spectrophotometric analysis of eluted RNA, it may be necessary to re-spin eluted samples and pipet aliquot from top of the liquid to ensure that the A260/230 is unaffected by possible elution of silica particles.

components.data: Place RNA on ice if being used for downstream steps, at -20°C for short-term storage (less than 1 week), or at -80°C for long-term storage. Addition of EDTA to 0.1-1.0 mM may reduce the activity of any contaminating RNases.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place RNA on ice if being used for downstream steps, at -20°C for short-term storage (less than 1 week), or at -80°C for long-term storage. Addition of EDTA to 0.1-1.0 mM may reduce the activity of any contaminating RNases.
Add 1X DNA/RNA Protection Reagent to sample.

components.data: Disrupt sample mechanically using a bead mill or similar device.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Disrupt sample mechanically using a bead mill or similar device.

components.data: Transfer lysate/homogenate to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer lysate/homogenate to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included).

components.data: Spin for 2 min (16,000 x g) to pellet debris.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin for 2 min (16,000 x g) to pellet debris.

components.data: Transfer supernatant to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer supernatant to an RNase-free microfuge tube (not included).

components.data: Add an equal volume of RNA Lysis Buffer and vortex briefly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add an equal volume of RNA Lysis Buffer and vortex briefly.
Add 1X DNA/RNA Protection Reagent to sample.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.protocol_name_html: Quick Protocol for Monarch® Total RNA Miniprep Kit (NEB #T2010)
source_data.annotation: Solid tissue samples should be submerged in protection reagent, not to exceed 10% (w/v). For maximal RNA recovery, tissues can be mechanically homogenized using a bead mill or similar device.
source_data.thread_text: Solid tissue samples should be submerged in protection reagent, not to exceed 10% (w/v). For maximal RNA recovery, tissues can be mechanically homogenized using a bead mill or similar device.
source_data.body: Solid tissue samples should be submerged in protection reagent, not to exceed 10% (w/v). For maximal RNA recovery, tissues can be mechanically homogenized using a bead mill or similar device.

components.data:
For every 300 µl of DNA/RNA Protection Reagent/sample mixture, add 30 µl Prot K Reaction Buffer + 15 µl Prot K*. Vortex briefly and incubate according to the chart below:

 

Sample Type Incubation Time at 55°C**
Homogenized Tissues 5 min
Solid Tissues 5-30 min
Leukocytes 30 min

* Doubling the Prot K volume may increase RNA yield for some tissues.
** Longer incubation times may result in decreased RNA integrity. Optimal time should be determined empirically, as yield and integrity vary with incubation time.
